Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2009 09:02PM angelcakes wrote: Thanks Shirlann for the info.  As i stated in my question, my pathology reports stated that my tumor had medullary features.  What i would like to know is just because my path reports stated that the tumor had medullary features, does that mean it was also medullary breast cancer or that it only has the features?
Posts.Title: Medullary Features and Medullary Carcinoma angelcakes MsBliss

Posts.Content: angelcakes wrote: What is the difference between Medullary features and Medullary Carcinoma? Are they the same thing?  I was reading online where a woman said that she had medullary features with her breast cancer and that that type of breast cancer is suppose to keep the breast cancer cells from spreading.  However she said that her doctor told her that the tumor just has medullary features and that it is not a medullary carcinoma so that really does not mean anything, and that the cancer cells can still spread.  Is this true? Posts.Title: Medullary Features and Medullary Carcinoma angelcakes MsBliss
